author: K Lakshmi
text:
For four years now, residents of Mogappair West have been waiting for the establishment of a comprehensive drinking water and sewerage network in their locality.

They continue to depend on private facilities as Chennai Metrowater projects are yet to be completed in their neighbourhood.

Members of JAMBA United Welfare Association, a conglomeration of associations of six areas, complained that only five per cent of the work to provide drinking water and sewerage connections was pending in the locality.

The Association secretary S.Swaminathan said: “We spend a minimum of Rs.2,000 to clear sewage through lorries every month. Metrowater has to just complete works in sewage pumping stations in Reddypalayam Road and Mogappair West.”

“Only minimal work is pending to provide piped water supply to the households. We have made several representations in the past. But, the delay in implementing the projects continues,” he said.

Residents of Mogappair West submitted a memorandum at the Chennai Metrowater’s head office on Friday and the officials have assured them that the schemes will be completed soon.

If the projects are not completed by March, residents plan to stage a demonstration.
title: Mogappair West residents on the warpath
